instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
This board had u8900 issue and was booting to black screen, it had also high fan spin before I even touched it.
I fixed the video issue by soldering and reflowing the U8900 ISL.
It is now displaying image but it has fans spinning very loud only after booting to OS.
I tested different internal ssd, diferent usb disks, different I/O board. It is not a trackpad/ts0p issue.
It passes ASD EFI and OS. On boot menu fans are quiet,
What am I missing? Could this still be an u8900 issue? Bios ?
thanks

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Run HWMonitor and see if any temp goes crazy.
Also test the machine disconnecting camera.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos, I tried removing all cables including the camera cable and still making fan very high when mac Os is launched same with different os or usb drive or internal ssd.

please see attached picture or under this link image of sensors on Hardware Monitor, to me nothing seems strange except CPU package graphics with no reading...

[URL="https://www.dropbox.com/s/wiryi1indpiun0n/IMG_6554.JPG?dl=0"]https://www.dropbox.com/s/wiryi1indp..._6554.JPG?dl=0[/URL]

Thanks

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Do you have original Apple Magsafe 2 85W charger?
On battery only, fans run high too?
Do the fans go to max instantly, or gradually increase after logged in?

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
I am using only original 85W magsafe 2.
Yes same with only battery on.
it starts gradually after logged in.
if I close the lid laptop goes to sleep, when I open it back, few second good and then again will gradually increase to full blast fans.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Power supply voltage looks high; 18.5V is normal for 85W.
Try the machine using 60W charger; just for test.
However gradually speed fan inceasing point to temp issue.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos, thanks for your support, I tested with a 60W charger and have the same issue.

I tested also the 85W charger on a known identical board and it still report 20.4V however one big difference I found was for the GPU.
on the known working board GPU current sensor is only showing 0,07A. On the loud fan board Gpu sensor shows 6A.

Don?t know if it would be more ISL8900 issue or gpu as the board seems to get warmer then the known working.

I attached a picture of HardwareMonitor on the known working board.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Post SMC_GPU_HI_ISENSE level.
Compare with known good board.
Check for corrosion around U/R5410.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
SMC_GPU_HI_ISENSE is 0,46V on boot menu
When fan is not high.
It is 0,127V when OS is loaded and fan full blast.

Unfortunately I don?t have anymore the known working board to compare. Will report as soon as I have another one:(

I still need to check U/R5410 and circuit.

Will report asap.
thanks

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
I just saw now 13.60A reported for Battery.
Post CHGR_BMON and SMC_CHGR_BMON_ISENSE values.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
I am sure HWMonitor default at 13,60V because battery was missing. I didn?t bother with that as I had the same value with known good working board.
Will post values asked as soon as I am in front of the board.

So far the only obvious difference I noticed is the current gpu sensor.

thanks

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
I got another [URL="tel:820-3332"]820-3332[/URL] and I compared again the values with Hardware Monitor,
here are the results:

Bad board
SMC_GPU_HI_ISENSE
0,46V on boot menu
0,127V when OS is loaded
[B]GPU current: 6A[/B]

2nd Good board
SMC_GPU_HI_ISENSE
0,35V on boot menu
0,04v when OS is loaded
[B]GPU current: 0.08A[/B]

First good board
[B]GPU current:0.07A[/B]

All the boards are consistently displaying 13,60A for battery I think it?s just because it?s unplugged.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Check GPU current when both boards have discrete GPU mode enabled.
Also compare on iGPU mode.

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
Here are my findings:

Good board:
iGPU: GPU current 0,09A fans spin quiet
dGPU: GPU current 7.02A fans spin quiet

Bad board:
iGPU: GPU current 5,84A fans spins high
dGPU: GPU current 7.03A fans spin quiet

Now I am a little bit ashamed about something:
ssd was empty and I decided to install a fresh OS and it?s not doing the weired fan spinning loud.

Still a mistery why my daily used usb flash os or external usb hdd has this effect only on this board...
Maybe a matter of SMC, EFI, version that doesn?t like to boot os by usb and messing with iGPU/dGPU? Or a gmux switching issue?

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message:
"iGPU: GPU current 5,84A fans spins high"
Maybe iGPU is not really enabled.
GPU cannot consumes such high current in this case.

Do you mean machine runs fine now, with fresh instaled OSX on internal SSD?

threads.title: 820-3332 high spinning fans just after os is booted.
threads.message: No finally machine still does'nt run fine..It looks like problem appear whenn  it's on iGPU when I switch to Dgpu fan is quiet, when I switch back ti IGPU fan goes crazy...
